title: Coronation Street star teases ‘dark and serious’ storyline on the way for 2020
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

It’s non-stop in Coronation Street at the moment with Robert Preston’s affair set to be uncovered, Sinead Tinker’s terminal cancer diagnosis and Gary Windass’ reign of terror. But it looks like the drama is set to continue well into the New Year, so we best sit tight and enjoy the ride.

Sally Dynevor, who plays the iconic Sally Metcalfe, caught up with Metro.co.uk on the red carpet at last night’s Inside Soap Awards 2019 and exclusively teased that there are exciting things on the horizon.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘There’s a lovely story, a comedy storyline coming up which is really good and then next year it gets a bit darker and more serious,’ she revealed.

‘There are some good things so I can’t wait for you to watch.’

Sally Dynevor has teased there’s loads of action on the horizon (Picture: PA)

On top of that, Sally also let loose that Christmas is not one to be missed either.

‘Well, I daren’t give anything away but there are some very, very exciting stories at Christmas,’ she said.

Meanwhile, Connie Hyde talked about her character Gina Seddon and whether we’d be likely to see her roaming the cobbles in the distant future.

‘We’ve not seen the end of her,’ Connie grinned. ‘There’s a lot of history there. A lot of stuff to do.’

Maybe 2020 will be the year Gina and Sally finally put their feud to bed?

description: Coronation Street star Sally Dynevor teases 'dark and serious 2020 storylines' on the way at Inside Soap Awards 2019.
